result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J Verdegan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to prison time being served.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution as shown on Door County Restitution Summary. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay costs of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Ryan J Verdegan
Current: PO Box 900, Redgranite Correctional Institution, Redgranite, WI 54970-0900 United States  (Effective: 02-16-2016)
Prior: 203 N Ashland Ave, Green Bay, WI 54304

Defendant Ryan J Verdegan appeared by video conference from Redgranite Correctional Institution. Attorney Peter J. Culp appeared by phone. Ray Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State advises of plea agreement. Defense agrees. Court questions Defendant, who agrees to handling of hearing by video conference. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 1. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 1. Count 2 is dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court questions Defendant, who agrees with repeater status. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
E-mail from JA to Defense requesting status
Video conference confirmed with Redgranite Correctional for 1/15/16 at 10:00. Defense will appear by phone.

Defendant Ryan J Verdegan appeared by video from Dodge Correctional. Attorney Peter J. Culp appeared in Court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of reduction in consequences that were proposed on revocation case, Defendant is in Dodge for 9 months, parties have reached agreement on this case. Court questions what next step should be. Discussion regarding restitution. Court questions Defendant, who has no objection to handling plea/sentencing by video conference. Defense questions whether he can appear by phone. Court agrees. Defense to contact JA to schedule plea/sentencing.
Confirmation from Dodge of availability for video conference on 11/9/15 at 9:30 a.m.

Theresa from Brown County Jail called. Defendant has been transported to Dodge Correctional. Called Dodge Correctional, who does not do video conferences from 11:30-1:00. Left message with Atty Culp to see if he's available at 11:15.

Spoke with Atty Culp, advised him of new time due to video conference. He questioned whether he can appear with Defendant at jail. Told him Court would have no problem with that, don't know if Brown Co. Jail allows that. He will contact them.

Defendant Ryan J Verdegan in court with attorney Peter J. Culp. Defendant Ryan J Verdegan in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of revocation hearing with appeal period that ends 9/17. Defense is working toward joint resolution of cases, hopes Brown County case will be resolved in October.  Status conference scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Ryan J Verdegan in court with attorney Peter J. Culp. Defendant Ryan J Verdegan in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defense in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty pleas. Defense requests status conference. Defendant is on probation hold.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
No contact direct or indirect with MS, GG. Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.

Defendant Ryan J Verdegan appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 7/20/15, 10:00.
